sponsor.partnerMessage: Since 1957, Underwoods has been committed to quality and value. Named "Coolest Store in America" by InStore Magazine, and winner of state, national, and international design awards, Underwoods' dedication to craftsmanship and design excellence creates timeless jewelry.

posts.title: Fare Flight NWA Offers Tips For Affordable Summer Travel
posts.content:
The staff at Northwest Arkansas National Airport is taking steps to increase the chances of finding an affordable fare to leisure destinations in the next few months despite inflation and rising prices.

  • 64 days: According to Travel + Leisure, the suggested time to book a domestic trip is 64 days before departure. That means, if you book flights this weekend, you’ll probably find the best deals on about July 15 give or take a few days. 
  • Other tips for affordable summer travel: 1) Travel on the holiday. July 4 is one of the more inexpensive days to travel. 2) Be flexible. The best deals on the low-cost carriers at XNA fly out during the week. XNA travelers last year saved around $8.1M in total when flying to these 10 cities.

For more tips, click HERE.

posts.title: City-Wide Bike-Drive Begins Today In Springdale
posts.content:
Springdale’s first-ever city-wide bike drive starts today to help support Pedal It Forward and its mission to provide everyone in NWA access to a bicycle.

  • Donate: Donated new and used bicycles of any size are being collected at Buffalo Builders office today and tomorrow (May 12 & 13), and at the Springdale Phat Tire Shop location on Saturday, May 14. Donated bikes can be dirty, have flat tires, or broken, but avoid giving bikes that are too damaged to repair. 
  • To race: Bikes raised at the drive will support 60 underserved children participating in the Natural State Criterium Race series this summer. 20 bikes will be given away at each of the races in June, July, and August.

Learn more HERE.

posts.title: Downtown Rogers To Host 'Bark on the Bricks' Today
posts.content:
It’s National Pet Month, and Downtown Rogers is celebrating today with a dog-themed “Bark on the Bricks” Art Walk!

  • Pup art: You all are invited to bring your furry friends to meet the vendors at Bark on the Bricks, which include: pet portrait artists and photographers, visual artists, and nonprofit organizations and businesses that serve the animal community. 
  • Tail waggin’: There will be dog trainers, groomers, veterinary clinics, pop-up adoption services, as well as a dance performance and a disco dance party at Turntable Plaza in the Railyard Park. The event will go from 4:30-7:30p tonight.

Click HERE for more information.

posts.title: Fayetteville Gets Its First Art Supply Store
posts.content:
Fayetteville’s first art supply store officially opened its doors late last month, making art and art supplies accessible to people of all artistic exposures and ages. 

  • Artists' tools: The store is called Sleet City and was created after the owner, a muralist in NWA, realized she had to leave the region to get her own work supplies. Now, Sleet City is working to have supplies and material for all artist’s needs. 
  • In stock: The store has art kits available intended to make art approachable for those who wouldn’t officially consider themselves creatives, and a lot of garden items and seed packets because of the overlap between traditional artist and people who get their hands dirty in the garden.

Learn more about Sleet City HERE.

posts.title: Walton Executive MBA Program Invites Professionals To Hone And Expand Skills
posts.topic: Sponsored by the Walton MBA Program at the University of Arkansas
posts.photoCredit: Walton MBA Program at the University of Arkansas
posts.content:
Transform your life and accelerate your career:

  • Look sharp: Through the Walton Executive MBA program, you’ll hone your leadership skills, expand your expertise in core business fields, travel the world in our global immersion experience, and make life-long connections with classmates and alumni. Your life and career will never be the same.
  • Designed for you: Mostly online, with only one in-person Saturday each month, this program is designed to accommodate the busy schedule of a working professional. There’s never been a better time than right now. Apply before July 1. 

Learn more HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily
pick.content:
• Reduce drafts: Boost your home comfort with no-cost air and duct sealing from SWEPCO.*
  • Prints: Mount Sequoyah's Creative Spaces has an active photography exhibit called Ozark Beauty.*
  • Legacy: Siloam Springs, Barnett's Dairyette is celebrating its 65th anniversary on June 4.*
  • Stars: Hobbs State Park is hosting an astronomy night this weekend. 
  • History: The University of Arkansas almost did not exist!
  • Address: Senator Boozman will deliver a keynote address in Bentonville tomorrow. 

*content is sponsored
